text: I'm ruined, says a friend who just lost his modest job as a school teacher. You're exaggerating, Luder is comforting. The poor have always been ruined. Only the rich have the privilege of ruining themselves. Although it's also true that a ruined rich will always be less poor than a poor rich. Finished by Luder, 1989
title: Dichos de Luder 38
author: Julio Ramón Ribeyro
